captions.text:
Twinkle Twinkle little star
You look small ‘cause you are far

Lightyears out from here to there
Your light's distorted by the air. So you

Twinkle twinkle little star,
Adaptive optics show you as you are

Twinkle twinkle little star
You must be a small pulsar

Out away from earth you drift
This is known from your redshift

Twinkle twinkle spinning star
Degenerate neutrons are what you are

Twinkle twinkle little star
Supernova, au revoir!

You got so big, too big perhaps
Electron capture, core collapse

Twinkle twinkle former star
A black hole’s all that you now are.

Twinkle twinkle little star
Wait, actually, no, you're a meteor

Breaking up in the atmosphere
I wish I’d known you'd end up here

Twinkle twinkle shooting star
Became a meteorite that hit my car

comments.text:
*ترانۀ علمی کودکانه*

ترانۀ کودکانۀ معروفی هست با اسم Twinkle, twinkle, little star (چشمک بزن 
ستارۀ کوچک). حدس می‌زنم ماها آهنگش را بیشتر روی الفبای انگلیسی شنیده‌ایم. 
goo.gl/wh38gA

برداشته‌اند متن این ترانه را *تصحیح* کرده‌اند - یعنی آن را طوری تغییر 
داده‌اند که به‌لحاظ علمی درست و آموزنده باشد! مثلاً
Twinkle, twinkle, little star,  how we wonder what you are
شده
Twinkle, twinkle, little star, you look small cause you are far
و در ادامه از شکست نور، سال نوری، الکترون و سیاه‌چاله هم حرف به میان آمده 
است!
اینجا می‌توانید ترانۀ جدید را بشنوید: goo.gl/gt5Jk3

ای کاش +امیرمسعود پورموسی، +samane noroozi، +Ehsan Irani  و +محی الدين  
دست‌به‌ست هم بدهند و متن ترانۀ جدید را به فارسی ترجمه کنند، طوری که بتوان 
آن را با همین آهنگ خواند.﻿

comments.text:
Hi, can you maybe do a video about what would happen if we truly didn't 
move at all? Because we are moving with earth and even if we wouldn't we 
would move with the universe expanding. But my question is what would 
happen if we completely stop moving? Because if you travel or move at 99% 
of light speed time is very slow for you and you could travel millions of 
years without aging one in our world. So i thought if we would stand truly 
still, would we die immediately because time runs so fast?﻿

comments.author: Peter Smythe

comments.text:
P.S. the reentry corridor for a meteorite of that size and apparent density 
(3000 kg/m^3) not to explode into dust at high altitude is absolutely tiny. 
1 degree or so at the minimum velocity it could have upon atmospheric entry.

On the other hand, the damage to the surroundings is, somewhat 
surprisingly, negligible. The meteorite would do hardly any damage to the 
surroundings, likely destroying the engine compartment and nothing else. 
The sound would be loud, but no fireball, blast wave, or shrapnel throwing 
would occur.﻿

"Twinkle, twinkle, little star.
Now we're learning what you are.
For by spectroscopic ken,
You're Helium and Hydrogen;
Twinkle, twinkle, little star.

I forgot who came up with this verse, but I came across a similar one in 
the book "Big Bang" by Simon Singh.﻿
